item.description: Witch! (Achtung Hexe!) is a card game for Ages 5 - 10 where the players try to steal the gingerbread cookies from the witch's house. However, if the witch catches you, you need to give up all the cookies you've found!

name.value: Fighting Formations: Grossdeutschland Motorized Infantry Division

item.description:
Fighting Formations is a fledgling series of games, which will focus on several battles of various individual formations during World War II. The first title in the series is "Grossdeutschland Infantry Division." Future titles aren't yet set in stone but could be devoted to other famous divisions (Big Red One), Corps (Afrika Korps), regiments (442nd RCT), Commando troops, Ranger battalions, etc.

The scale of the game is 75 meters per hex with turns representing about 5 minutes of real time. Units are squads, guns with their inherent crews, and individual vehicles. Platoons are also employed.

The game has card Assets -- including such things as snipers, artillery, air support or demolitions -- but is not card-driven. It is also not the typical Igo-Yougo fare with a strict sequence of play. Instead, the base game engine is an impulse-type back and forth mechanic whereby the various Orders carry with them a certain cost in Initiative, with the person having the most Initiative at any given time being able to take the next action on the map.

This first game has the following components:

4 22" x 34" back-printed mapsheets
5 countersheets
55 cards
24-page series rulebook
48-page playbook
an 8.5" x 22" track display
several cardstock player aids
dice: 2d6, 2d8, 2d10, 2d12 & 2d20
10 wooden cubes
1 wooden pawn

Fighting Formations FAQ

item.description:
The Cat in the Sack is a very simple dexterity game. It consists of a large plastic base in the shape of a blue sack. Inside the sack is a large white cover for the sack on which is mounted a large plastic cat head. The cover is mounted to the sack with a large spring (reminiscent of a jack-in-the-box). Along the edge of the "sack" are 25 clips that hold the cover in place.

To play the game, you push the spring loaded cover down into place, securing it in place with the clips. The game begins and each player takes a turn removing one of the clips, trying not to let the cat out of the sack. The player who removes a clip and causes the cat to spring out of the sack, loses the game.

item.description:
The opera 'Turandot' is about to go on stage, but who will sing the aria 'Nessun dorma' is still a mystery! Can you recruit the best and most talented cast of singers to perform this masterpiece of the maestro Giacomo Puccini? Choosing a brilliant director may be your most important choice!

A quick card-game for 3-5 players (with a 2 player variant). Based on the Nessun Dorma lyrical aria by Giacomo Puccini, Turandot requires the players to gather a team of six singers in order to enact that very piece of the Turandot. Players recruit singers and a director using a simultaneous selection mechanic, with an original twist.

Artwork by professional illustrator Martino Palladini.

item.description:
Counting quickly and snatching the correct number of cards from the middle of the table - that's almost all there is to it, but this is easier said than done. Since while checking the motifs and colours, there could suddenly be more or less.

The game contains 14 number cards that are laid out on the table. Each number card has three numbers on it. For each round, four motif or search cards are turned up. Players look at the search cards, which may show colours or symbols, then count the number of matching colours and symbols on the motif cards. When they think they've got the number right, they take one number card from the middle of the table.

The numbers are checked, and everyone who has a correct number cards scores a point. The number cards go back into the middle of the table and the next round begins.

If the cards turned up are only search cards, then the result is zero - and there are number cards with zero on them, so those are the ones people try to grab. If only motif cards are turned up, another set of cards is turned up.

There is a variation for 2 to 4 children aged 6 and up, with fewer number cards, placed the other way up so that there is only one number showing. In this version, the search cards and motif cards are separated and only one search card is turned up each round.

This game uses an 33â…“ LP recorded by New York Yankees announcer Mel Allen to determine the outcomes of baseball plays. Each side of the LP has seven tracks, for use in different game situations. Each track has four interleaved grooves announcing the resulting play, leading to different outcomes based on which groove happens to catch the phonograph needle. The back of the LP sleeve itself is used as a game board.

WWF Superstars Card Game was sold in double packs featuring two WWF wrestlers. Each wrestler is represented by a 30-card deck, although the card distribution is identical for each deck.

Players draw a hand of four cards and take turns either playing or discarding a card and then drawing a new one. Players try to have the highest Takedown card in the center stack. Break] cards restart the stack. If a player is unable to play a card, they must discard. If your opponent discards, you can then play a Pin card, which can only be defeated by an Illegal Hold. If you are able to play two [i]Pin[/i] cards and then a Referee, you gain 3 points, and a new round begins. Else, if both players' decks run out, the last player to play a card gains 1 point. The first player to 5 points wins.

Out of the box, the game is for 2 players. However, a second set allows for 4-player tag team matches.

Fair Shake -- "The fun filled fast moving game of luck for two to six players"

(c)1972 Leisure Life

"The pace is quick, the action exciting in this fascinating game of dice and cards. Fair shake deals you a handful of fun."

Players are dealt five cards from a special deck and then roll five dice in an attempt to match the die roll with cards they hold. Players can make a second roll without revealing their card combinations.

Players score based on how quickly they discard matching sets.

Includes cards, dice, six plastic card holders, and rules printed on an illustrated storage insert.

Trail 98: A Historical Card Game of the Klondike Gold Rush.

Half-a-dozen cards make up the playing board, and players use their cards (claims, goods, strike, hit, bonus, passage, provisions) to make their way from Seattle to Dawson and to lay down as many claims as possible. Player with the most claims wins. But you can put a hit card like Avalanche, to slow players down and it's likely you're run into a storm, sandbar, log jam or some other hit cards along the way.

From the instruction book: "Welcome to the Klondike gold Rush of 1898! This card game takes players up the scenic Inside Passage from Seattle through historic Skagway and along the rugged Chilkoot Trail to Dawson, where they work the gold fields. along the way, players encounter difficulties of the trail, as well as some bonuses..."

Lookee is the "Search-A-Word Game", for 2 or more players, that can be played by those of all ages. The game consists of a plastic tile board and 100 various tiles each with a letter and point assigned to it on each side. The game has five different variations of play. In Game One: The grid begins empty except for the word LOOKEE spelled out in the center. Using at least one letter on the board each player must take turns making their own word (with the 7 tiles they began with) using at least one pre-existing tile.Each turn must be finished within 30 seconds. These words could be spelled forward, backward, horizontally, vertically or diagonally. Each player scores points for all the letters on their new word. After each turn, the player who went replenishes back to seven tiles. The player with the most points after the grid is filled is the winner. Game Two: First player to reach 100 points wins. In this game, the entire tile board is filled with letters at random. The first player tries to locate a word in any direction, and receives the added points for that word. The tiles used are then flipped over creating a new board every turn. The next player goes and so on. Only 30 seconds per turn. Game Three: Same as game two except additional option. Look for letter groupings that can be rearranged to form words. E.G. T,C,R,U,K can be TRUCK. First to 100 points wins. Game Four: Play solitaire by setting up the board as in Game One. Score as many points as possible in a given time period. Game Five: By using another game board, a duplicates version could be played by using identical letters and setting a time limit.

Reed's Game of Base Ball is a dexterity game where players use little wooden bats to whack a dowel seated in a groove on the edge of the game board. The space where the dowel comes to rest indicates which Baseball play has occurred.

From the box. A Family Get Together Game. A competitive fast moving game of skill & Strategy with a unique playing board. There are three ways to line up your marbles and hundreds of ways to play and win. Strategically designed blocking panels. Mislead your opponent ... attack and counter attack. Think one or two moves ahead and hope your opponent spoil your game plan.

Klapse - German for "Nuthouse" - is a Monopoly-like roll-and-move game with a strong satirical approach. There are two "circles" - the "locked ward" and the "open ward" - for the pawns to walk around and step on "event"-spaces of different kinds: New diagnosis, several events ...

The players try to get their pawns from the "locked" into the "open" ward and from there to freedom stepping on a "discharge" space. In the beginning, players draw a "diagnosis", which reduces their possibilities in walking forward.

There are many satirical cards and texts on the board, plus in the "active" variant (the full game) players can discard their "diagnosis" cards, when acting out the symptoms ...

A game without depth or strategic approach, but a pure mock and fun game about psychiatrists and looney bins - mainly made for people working in that area (the publisher is specialized in critical literature about psychiatry).

Jerusalem is a German Game about a sight-seeing tour in modern Jerusalem. The Players have the tasks to make photos of places of interest. The plans for each tour are hidden from the other players. Special events are handled by event-cards. Additionally the players have to bargain for special souvenirs. The player who was able to make all photos and buy all souvenirs first wins.

A game of skill, intrigue and fun(chess/draughts level). Based on 3,000 years of folklore, customs and superstitions of the spring festival of fertility. Players pit their wits against each other to move their own 15 pieces, which can be moved in varying ways, across the maroon and white board while outmaneuvering, blocking and capturing the pieces of their opponents with the aim of scoring the most points.

A western-themed card game in which players attempt to play card combinations to draw guns (2,2 ; 3,5,7, ; 4,5, ; 3,8) and shoot the cowboys (kings) from other players hands, while trying to shack up their own cowboys with harlots (queens) along the way for extra points. At the end of the game, players gain or lose points for the sets of cards (gangs, posses, harems, orphanages, etc.) that they've managed to collect, during play.

Home Page: http://www.wyomingcowboy.org/

item.description:
Jules Verne’s classic novel Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea tells the story of Captain Nemo and his astounding ship, the Nautilus.

Set in year 1866, this amazing electric-powered submarine travels across the seas tacitly on missions of research and exploration, but it isn’t long before two captive crew members, rescued from the wreck of a Nautilus attack, Professor Aronnax and Canadian whaler Ned Land, suspect Captain Nemo’s motives are more complex and perhaps sinister.

Can you command the Nautilus on its year-long cruise to destiny? Can you fend off giant squids, discover the South Pole, the Arabian Tunnel or the lost city of Atlantis? Can you scourge the high seas and create enough fear in the great maritime powers to free the oppressed colonial peoples of the world? There really is a whole new world to of adventure to explore and master when you are fighting Nemo’s War.

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale

Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale

Scale: Time is measured in weeks; each unit represents 1 major ship (its crew and contents) and each area is 1 ocean

Game Components:
> 6 pages of color Rules
> 24 Adventure cards
> 54 color, die-cut 3/4" square ship counters
> 45 color, two-sided die cut 1/2" round markers
> One 11" x 25.5" color game map
> 1 Adventure Epilogue sheet
> 1 Score Sheet

item.description:
From the box:

The starting signal for the big horse race is audible and the horses start to run. After a while you notice an exciting neck and neck race on the racetrack. The lead changes all the time. Place your cards in a clever way so that your horse wins in the end. An exciting horse race for 2-4 players where the horses are moved by number cards.

Gameplay description:

There are two different ways to play the game:

1. Each player plays a card on his turn and moves his horse.

2. Each player plays a hidden card and all the cards are revealed at the same time. The lowest cards and the highest cards are discarded, and the other players move their horses. Two special cards (gallop and walk) can change this procedure.

After ten rounds (each player has ten cards), the player with the most lap token wins.

Spartacus is a solo game. The player represents Crassus attempting to defeat Spartacus and his Slave Army. His objective in this is to acquire personal prestige, and so it is important to the player that Spartacus is destroyed or driven from Italy before Pompey or Lucullus arrive with their veteran armies, who will presumably make short work of the slaves.

From Wikipedia

Hardtack was the first U.S. published American Civil War rules set and had an early following. However, by the end of the decade, it had been supplanted by Scott Bowden's Stars and Bars and John Hill's Johnny Reb 3 and is rarely played at modern wargaming conventions. However, it is considered as groundbreaking, and ushered an era of Civil War miniature wargaming in the USA.

Introduction by Gary Gygax
Painting Guide by Don Lowry

Guidon Games Product # WM103

Preface:

This comprehensive set of rules is designed to take a person who has never played miniatures before thru several increasing stages of realism to the point where he can create for himself the kind of Civil War game which is most suited to his own personality. When you have read and played everything this booklet contains, you will be prepared to design a Civil War game which has all the simplicity necessary for a great game. The first version described is called the TRAINING GAME because it is designed to teach the basic mechanics of recreating Civil War battles with miniatures soldiers. When it can be played without referring back to the rules, learn the more realistic BASIC GAME.
Players travel around the board answering questions about the bible. The first player to reach the finish line is the winner.

Published in Battlegames Issue 2 (2006), this paper-and-pencil matrix battle campaign system allows wargamers to play a series of linked battles, the set up of each being dependent on the outcome of the previous battle. Designed to allow an entire campaign (five games) to be fought in one day of real time play.

As written, the campaign rules are for a medieval game but may easily be adapted to other time periods.

Based on the Italian Comic Book / TV show "Monster Allergy". Each player has his/her own deck of cards, choosing 30 out of the available packs. There are cards in five colours, but players are only allowed to choose cards of three colours, so the influence on the cards played in the game by the other player might be limited. Also, several icons and numbers, plus some descriptive texts showing different values, powers and abilities of the cards.

The rounds are "days", in which in a strict order powers, friends, monsters and so on are placed onto the board. This has two personal zones - one for each player - and a neutral zone, in which the monsters are placed and attacked/captured in the main phase of each round. Aim of the game is to capture monsters with the total value of "10" through activating the power cards, but the other player can protect monsters with his/her cards, losing these powers for capturing doing so.

After the "attack / capture" phase, there is a "night phase", in which several monsters` activities are executed. Some more twists are interlaced in the system of the cards, influencing each other and offering some tactical decisions.

In the starter set there are two decks with 30 cards each - the total of available cards is 111.

Packed in a nice "Bombo" monster figure as storage for cards, player mats and rulebook.

item.description:
Letter is an unusual word game. As with many word games, there are letter tiles which are laid on a grid in order to form words. What is unusual about Letter is that the letter tiles are different sizes: 1×1, 1×2, 1×3, 2×1, 2×2, 2×3, 3×2, and 3×3 (because orientation matters). Words are identified by chaining along orthogonally adjacent sides of the letters. As a result, the board can quickly come to look like quite a jumbled mess of letters with varied sizes, but this provides opportunities for lateral thinking in playing that next tile. Each play initiates a Boggle-style word search, but with deference to the active player.

Debuted in Essen 2008.

Schwarzer Freitag is a stock trading game with a built-in bubble to explode. The players are buying shares on a growing stock market, but at one time in the game the prices will crash. The players try to find out the right time to sell their shares and buy gold and silver (these are the victory points), before the market crashes.

The actions of all players change the probability of the crash. When they start selling, the probability of the crash will get higher. If they only buy shares then the crash will come later.

To win the game, you have to have a close look at what the others do to be in the position to sell the highest share at the right time, to get the most money. But the silver/gold price will rise too, and you can also win by buying silver/gold early in the game.

This game is the first game in the Freitag-Projekt:

Freitag(Friday) is a game project started on Friday 24th of October in Essen. I, Friedemann Friese, will work on that project for the next Five years on every Friday. I will work Five, Fifteen,... minutes (In German twenty-five, thirty-five,.. starts with an F, too) up to Fifteen hours on that project, but only Fridays.

The game will be published in Five years on the Friday of Spiel '13 in Essen. It will not be shown on Wednesday or Thursday.

I have a blog (by now only in German) on my website, where I show my work on that project.

By now I really don't know what will happen, but I have a lot of time......

Now it happened that the first game is ready and I found a company for publishing (the company is very interested, but it is not totally sure by now)

I will add the new second game to the database.

item.description:
Neu (read as Noi), the Japanese card game that has quite similar rules to the 98/99/100 (information from www.Pagat.com) that can be played by the standard deck.

The components of the game are 21 chips and 58 cards. The chips are distributed to the players (3 each) and used as life counter, the player that loss all chips will be the loser and must leave the game.

This game has more options than 98/99/100 because it has been published for playing this game.

For more information about 98/99/100 of standard deck follow the link here http://www.pagat.com/adders/98.html

The object of 'Full On World Soccer (i.e. football) is to score more goals than your opponent. To do this, you move your eleven players (coloured discs representing one of 32 countries) around the board to control the ball. Each turn the player in possession of the ball rolls three six-sided dice (including one directional die) and moves the ball accordingly. The aim is to move the ball into the goal or to another one of the players on the same team to retain possession. The game ends at the end of the allotted time. Two 30 minute halves are suggested in the rules, however any length game could be played.

From the publisher:

Officially licensed Monty Python game of buying and selling property in King Arthur's Britain while hunting for the Holy Grail.

You, too, can quest for the Holy Grail, buy hovels, build castles, enjoy a spanking, and even make it to Scene 24! Charge excessive groats for hanging out at your Castle of Aaarrrggghhh in this great game based on Monty Python and the Holy Grail.

A trivia game for children. Collect one card from each category by answering correctly, then move to the goal square in the middle of the board to win.

Similar to Trivial Pursuit.

The goal is to get four of one kind of card. The active player asks another player of his/her choice for a card, and if there is a match he receives it and gets to ask again. If not, the turn goes over to the next player in line.

This game is similar to another Swedish cardgame called "Finns i sjön" (Go fish) which is played with an ordinary deck of cards.

This game won a 2008 Korea Board Game Award from the Republic of Korea Ministry of Culture, Sports, and Tourism.

item.description: The goal of the game is to score points by associating from categories such as "famous love-couples" etc. You either get point from associating the same as your competitors, or uniquely, depending on how you roll the dice.

The Ski Sprung Spiel (in English: Skijump Game) is trying to simulate a ski jump competition. After team selection each player will roll dice for selecting the highest position on the jump tower. Therefore all seven dice are rolled. After each roll at least one die has to be set aside face up. When all dice have been allocated the jumper is placed on the tower according to the rolled total result which is equivalent to a certain jump distance in meters. After all players are set up one player puts one of his jumpers for the jump. Then card play takes over. The effect of cards is to add or subtract jumping length from the a fore determined jumping length (the dice roll) or to move the jumper left and right on the hill simulating wind. Other players play cards for this jumper which are countered by the jumping player. This goes in turn i.e. player A plays card jumping player plays card, player B plays card jumping player plays card and so on until each non-jumping player had the chance to play a card. If the jumper is moved too much to the left or right or too long or too short of the board it is counted as a fall. Finally the jumping player plays a card for the landing again adding or subtracting metres. The final result will be noted down. The player which ski jumper has the farthest jump wins the game.

item.description:
a resource management game for 2 to 4 players, using the Decktet

The Lord High Chancellor has retired, but the King has not yet named a successor. As one of the King's Chancellors, you are hoping to move up to the first seat. To do this, you need to impress His Majesty and outdo the other Chancellors. Fail and you'll be a back bencher for the rest of your career. Of course, things could be worse than being a mere Chancellor. If things go too badly, the King might decide to fire all the old advisers.

item.description:
A fun little game from the early 1970s drug culture. The goal of the game is to make money buying and selling "kilos" (of what is left to your imagination).

Simple roll and move mechanics. Start with $1000. Cross the border to buy kilos from various sources (Edwardo, Renaldo, Jose, ...) then attempt to cross the border and sell your recent purchase in various U.S. cities (from Tucson to New York).

If you're carrying kilos you can be busted by various U.S. government agencies. One nice touch if you're not carrying to you can "fly" to the start space for $100 from anywhere on the board. There's even other odds and ends to purchase that can help you out (lawyers, fake id, "heater")

Play to a certain preset goal ($25,000 to $100,000, is suggested, but more or less will work).

item.description:
Each player plays their favourite 'ganxta', tries to build their reputation, choose the correct tactics and to become the boss of the underworld at the end of the game.

The system is based on communication between the players. The game board does not say whai happens, but what could happen. Everything is decided by the result of a 'roshambo' with the other players. You can try to guess your opponent's intentions, bargain with them, trick them, even bribe them.

The game takes place in four quarters, from the ghettos to the luxury of the choicest casino.

Further details on www.rebelshop.cz

Mind Acrobats: The players must find a way to the goal through the mind paths of the game board as quickly as possible.

Edition Spielbox #85 - from issue 5/2008

This French-language educational game consists of 16 sets of 3 tiles each depicting important French leaders from Vercingetorix to Napoleon III. Each set of tiles displays the head (plus name and birth and death dates), torso, and legs of the leader in question. All three cards are marked with the same identifying number (1-16). The game also comes with a 4-page biographical survey of the depicted leaders.

For the under-6's, the game is simply one of putting the tiles together to form the leaders. In the solitaire version, the child attempts to correctly construct all 16 figures. In the two-player version, children flip tiles one at a time by turn, trying to build the leaders. The child with the most complete leaders wins.

The game for 6-and-overs plays with a simple Go-Fish mechanic where 2-3 players take turns trying to reconstruct the famous leaders of French history by asking each other for specific body parts and pulling from the draw pile if they don't get them. Again, the winner is the player who has reconstituted the most historical personages before the draw pile is gone and someone has run out of tiles.

The first game release of Michael Schacht based on his 1995 finalist of the "Hippodice Autorenwettbewerb".

The game is about producing bands and releasing records. Depending on the positions in the charts the players get more or less fame and money.

'Little Game'

All players are editors of the Spielerei German Games magazine and they all want to show their 5 latest reviews to the chief editor. But only the only review that will be printed is the one that is shown first to the chief editor.

name.value: Nicke & Nilla: Spel & bus på vinden

item.description: The goal of the game is to collect "Nicke & Nilla" tokens. You gain tokens by following instructions from the cards, as well as challenge and win tokens from your fellow players.

Miffy (Nijntje) plays on the beach with her friends, collecting shells.

Three big Miffy "Meeples", in three different colors, are used to collect shells on the beach, using color-sided dice (D6).

a nice plus: the "meeples" can also be used to really play in the sand!

item.description: This set includes three types of dice: 5 poker dice, 5 regular dice, and a die showing various parts of the body. Also in the package is a dice cup and a hardcover book that describes proper dice rolling etiquette, the distribution of outcomes (bell curve), and rules for 19 games many of which include a variation using the die with the body parts.

Diamond Dynasty includes two Gold Decks of Domino 32 cards, two Silver Decks of Domino 32 cards, a set of Play Money (80 pieces, 8 denominations), the Domino 32 Card Games booklet which includes the rules for 9 games, printed out rules for the games Twister: Dragon Dances and Diamond Dynasty along wit ha set of scoring sheets.

Bohnenspiel (Bean Game) is an old German game for two players that belongs to the Mancala family of pit and seeds games.

As for the other games in the Mancala Family, the goal of the game is to accumulate more seeds in player's storehouse than the opponent.

This is done by landing the last seed you are "sowing" in some pit bringing the total number of seeds in that pit to two, four or six. All previous pits containing two, four or six seeds are captured as well.

The game includes two sets of rules. First is for the small children the second set is for the little older children.

name.value: High School Musical 3 Mystery Date Game

item.description:
Collect three clothing and accessory cards to get ready for prom...with one of four dates. Ready to coordinate your dress with Ryan's tie, but Zeke shows up instead? Open the door to reveal a matching prom date and you win.

Components:
Gameboard with Mystery Door
-5 Mystery Dates
-48 Clothing/Accessory Cards
-4 pawns with stands
-dice
-instructions

item.description:
Medina de Rioseco 1808 covers the battle of the 14 July 1808 between French army of marshal Bessières and the two Spanish armies of lieutnant-generals La Cuesta and Blake.

This game belongs to the Jours de Gloire series.

Rules: Jours de Gloire Empire version 1808
Scale: 1 hex. = 300 m - 1 counter = 1 battalion/squadron
Map size: A2

Spanish army: 22.000 men - 44 counters
French army: 13.000 men - 27 Counters

Published in Vae Victis Magazine No. 83 together with Somosierra 1808

item.description:
Basic childrens' game based on the Disney's Mickey Mouse Clubhouse television show.

From the box:
"Make a match with Mickey and friends. Have a blast with the cast of the Mickey Mouse Clubhouse Show. Match numbers on one side of the gameboard, then flip it over and see if you can match letters to spell the names of favorite characters. Will you be the Hot Dog in this game?

Reinforces:
Number matching
Letter Recognition
Basic words

A game over the battle of Stirling 1297. 
William Wallace defeated the combined English forces of John de Warenne, 7th Earl of Surrey and Hugh de Cressingham
The game use the Sredniowiecze system and it has a 100/70 cm map, 240 counters. The rules are in Polish.

Crypt: Monster and magic in a dungeon you create!

In Crypt, players take on the role of evil wizards who control competing monster forces, which move about in a dungeon that constantly grows. Each turn, a player may take one of three actions: lay a tile which expands the dungeon, move a monster in his force, or cast a magic spell. The objective is to move your monsters into enemy Crypts.

Monsters begin the game in their home Crypt. Each has a strength and movement rating. Strong monsters are slow, weak ones fast. Which will you play early and which will you save for later? Which will you use to defend, and which will seek entry into enemy Crypts?

Dungeon tiles are used to build the dungeon. Lay them carefully to block monsters from entering your Crypt, and make entryways into enemy Crypts.

Spell tiles keep things interesting. Poisons lower abilities; Potions raise them. A Reaper could mean instant death, while a Seraph returns you safely to your Crypt. Traps stop movement, while a Ghost lets you walk through walls. Or use Transporters to pop up in unexpected places. Suffering under an enemy spell? Remove it with a Zapper.

Crypt is an easily-learned, quick-playing tile-laying game suitable for 2-4 players Ages 8 and up. It is available as a self-published print-and-play game.

name.value: The hand that feeds, the hand that beats

item.description:
The Hand That Feeds, The Hand That Beats.

Gods want power
... they'll do whatever it takes to get it...

In a world of faith, or better: a world of faiths, different followers worship different Gods.
The more faith and followers, the stronger a God is.
So they play their game of power and strength and sometimes just use the followers as playing pieces...

In The Hand that FEEDS, the Hand that BEATS, players represent a God and His followers. The priest of your faith
may call a creature that scoops up the whole village and moves them around the board. The followers can then be used
to acquire resources with which they build obilisks or the temple or a part of one of the Gods' wonders: The Great Canal, The pyramid or the Mighty Colossus.

Three conditions trigger the game end:
1] If all three of the Gods' wonders are finished at the end of a round, the game ends.
2] If the creature-deck runs out, the round is played to the end, after which the game ends.
3] After ten rounds, the game ends.

Players try to score the most victory points (VPs).

 If they build or convert obelisks or the temple they immediately score VPs.
 If they build parts of the Gods' wonders, they can score VPs every round.
 If they control the obelisk in the oasis, they score VPs if other players use the oasis.
 Some of the actions, miracles and disasters will earn a player VPs.
 Lastly, and most importantly, the most popular faith will be elected to feed all the players and receives VPs equal to the popularity of the faith.

The Valley of the Death is a solitary game about the famous charge of the Light Brigade as a part of the fourth phase of the Battle of Balaclava on October the 25th of 1854.

The game simulates the twenty terrible minutes of the charge against the Russian cannons, the combat against the gunners, the Russian cavalry, and finally the retreat of embattled survivors who were pursued by the Russian until the British lines.

In the game, the principal characters of the Light Brigade are represented. As an example Lord Cardigan who rode in the front of lines, Captain Nolan who actively participated in the mistake that led the Light Brigade into Death Valley; Captain Morris of the 17th Lancers, etc. Details of the historical events are included, even the two dogs “Boxer” and “Jemmy” who were part of the charge are represented”.

item.description:
Do you want to vote a Pope? Now it’s possible. Conclave recreates the event in which a new Pope is being elected. You represent one of the factions within the Vatican and your goal is to become the most powerful. 
During a conclave you know each player has to vote for a cardinal, but how will they vote? And how can you convince them how to vote? Who is your friend, who is your foe? Make your own plan, see what the others are up to, but most importantly, vote tactically and become the most powerful faction within the Vatican.

Conclave recreates the event in which a new pope is being elected. The factions of cardinals use their influence to make one of them the new Pope. You represent one of those factions and it is your task to gain the most influence, and to be the Pope-maker

This game have been created by two people who have time to waste on school day. A game which just needs : A pencil, a piece of sheet grid, a Friend and your Brains. Cause it's a strategic game, where you need to fight and conquer territory, by strangle your enemy in a prison of holes. Ok. Now here is the rule.

As told above, the only things you need, is Pencil and Sheet grid, That's right, no eraser just that. Its a game which is simple to do, to play, and to explain. Just few rules to understand and you can play.

What about the story ? Imagine that you are in a limited zone, with a chosen draw as player. You move and shoot each turn. When you move, you blacken your old player and place a new one at movement range. When you shoot, you blacken the place you shot from which is in Attack Range. A place which is Blackened cannot be passed through and is considered as an empty box. When the players ( all players ) aren't connected ( divided by empty boxes. ) The game ends, and the winner is the player with the most space. This game maybe looks boring but it isn't! Try it, its cost you nothing.

A lot of variants can be made, from the mines to Multiplication Artifact and Invisible Shield. Same for the Mod, Capture Flag, Zombie mod, Team, Werewolf. Infinite possibilities.

Pex is a two-player abstract board game played on a board with pentagonal tiling.

Both players place stones trying to form a chain connecting opposite sides of the board marked with their color.

This game is a close relative to Hex but the unique tiling makes the game strategies different.

item.description: Godzilla: Monsters Attack! is a co-operative game based on the Godzilla franchise. At the start of the game, two monsters are chosen from a collection of monsters from the Godzilla universe. During the game, the monsters randomly move around the board fighting each other, fighting military units, and destroying cities. The players lose if the monsters cause too much destruction. To prevent this, players need to move around the board investigating various locations to uncover a plot. Once the players have done enough investigating, one of numerous plot cards is drawn. The plot provides a win condition for the players but also makes the monsters more powerful. The players must then race to meet the win condition before the monsters destroy Japan. Aside from uncovering and resolving a plot, players may also build and mobilize military units to prevent the monsters from damaging the cities and buy valuable time.

a territory control game for 1-3 players, using the Decktet

Jacynth is among the oldest cities, and a map of its streets is a record of history. It is a haphazard maze of overlapping interests and neighborhoods, with intricate social bonds tying one block to the next. You could control the city if you could control a nexus in that maze of ancient intrigue, but first you would have to find it.

item.description:
From the rule book cover:

"EDUCATIONAL
Learn business terms and practices...
stock market, high finance, bartering...
Become wiser by trading and manipulating...
A game of skill combined with chance...

ENTERTAINING
Interesting to young and old...
Delightfully amusing...
Every game different...
One throw of the dice and you may "gain" a hotel or "lose" your shirt...
but one thing is sure that everyone will enjoy the game..."

Inside Track is a for 3-6 players based on business principles of purchasing, leasing, and bartering. Play progresses with players taking leases on different businesses, each with different income properties. Play continues, until all but two players are bankrupt. At that time players have a final audit of the last two players to determine the winner. The object of the game is to accumulate the greatest wealth (leased property and money) at the final audit.

Hexe Lilli is a famous German children‘s book character. 
In the game Hexe Lilli (witch Lilli) makes a big chaos when performing magic. The players have to keep in mind where the different sized bewitched things are.

Allways wanted to A-bomb Norway and steamroll and 
put tarmac all over it, including the cities and the civilians?

NUKE NORWAY NOW / Handmade not mass produced version.
English version officially released at Essen2009 together with NNN "the soundtrack"
Swedish version Officially released: 7 December 2008 (No longer produced)
Tactical & strategical boardgame for 2players 
( includes a 3player scenario also)
Age: Ages 12 and up with an adult explaining the rules)
Gameplay time: 180minutes +

Including in the game box:

name.value: Star Wars Clone Wars: Das letzte Gefecht

item.description: The large, strategic board game Star Wars - Das letzte Gefecht features the ultimate last battle deciding on victory or defeat of the Jedis. Players not only need tactics, but also strong nerves. Face the ultimate final battle – save the world. In this game you have to choose the right allies in the solar system to stand the chance to win. The right combination of your ally’s strategy and your own tactics boost your chances to emerge victorious in the last battle.

From the same publisher of Vom Neanderthaler zum Ã–tzi, another card-driven educational game with a prehistoric theme.
The cards represent typical elements in the life of Neanderthal men: companions, resources, dangers.
40 cards are distributed face down on the table: the players uncover one of them at every turn. In some cases they can keep the card (if, for example, it represents food, a companion or another useful resource), in other cases they have to remember the card position, because it can be useful later, for example to defend the player against a dangerous animal.
The winner is the first player to collect seven cards that he or she can keep (resources or allies).

Dungers are smelly, noisy cantankerous beasties who overrun the wastelands. Entrepreneurial gangers will often organize a race, or a derby, with these vile critters and hilarity usually abounds!

Dunger Derby is a simple racing game for kids (or adults for whilst drinking!). The set comes with rules, card counters, 5 resin Dungers and a resin Ring of Random.

item.description: In this game you are a famous Brazilian surfer and must be the first to surf five points in order to win.

Mascate was a non collectible cardgame about commerce in Colonial Brasil (Circa XVII, XVIII centuries). The player was a Mascate ( a kind of Trader in Brasil), and he travels at the principal cities in Colonial Brasil transporting cargo and goods. The games was designed for solitaire mode and four players.

Game Art by brazilian artist José Augusto Praguer


Mascate é um jogo de cartas não colecionável que retrata o comércio no Brasil Colonial. Os jogadores são Mascates, onde através de viagens passam por perigos e aventuras, desbravando o território Brasileiro, em busca de fama e riqueza. O jogo pode ser jogado de 1 a 4 jogadores a partir de 10 anos e tem como objetivo desenvolver a estratégia, além do gosto pela história nacional. O Jogo tem duração média de 60 minutos e pode ser jogado por toda a família !

Arte do Jogo pelo Artista José Augusto Praguer

"It's What They Want For Christmas!"

Santa has only five houses left to deliver gifts to this Christmas Eve. Unfortunately, the town is rife with hunters who only want one thing for Christmas—venison! Will Santa be able to deliver all the toys to the good little boys and girls before the hunters shoot all of his reindeer down?

Venison is a flicking game with one player assuming the role of the hunter and the other of the reindeer. The reindeer player's goal is to deliver gifts to all five houses by flicking his reindeer pieces into them. The hunter's goal is to kill all of the reindeer using pieces representing claw traps and bullets.

A racing game aimed at younger children, NOVA RACE has elements of classic games such as Chutes and Ladders, The Game of Goose and Sorry to name a few. It has a space theme in which each player represents a different company racing to be the first to reach the Nova. Simple roll and move mechanics move the player along, while various spaces on the board have differing symbols which represent a specific action. A guide is included to explain the meaning of each symbol. As in life, the players will encounter events which both help and hinder their race to the nova. Suggested Ages 5 and up. Suggested number of players is 2 to 4. Estimated playing time is 20 to 30 minutes.

In Latvija Galda Spele you have 400 cards with 2400 questions from six categories : Miscellaneous, History, Sport, Culture, Nature and Geography. Most questions concern Latvia. Collect a token from each category to win. The players roll a die to move and then they must answer a question from the category they land on. If they answer correctly they get a token and when they've gathered tokens in every colour, they can head to the capital (center). First they need to get to a corner of the board where they answer a question of their own choosing. Then there are two coloured spaces from the corner to the center. When the players get to the center they answer a question of the other player(s) choosing. A correct answer in the center means victory!

item.description: The first Polish edition of the classic trivia game. It has 2400 questions in 6 categories: geography, entertainment, history, literature & arts, science & nature, sports & leisure.

name.value: Strawberry Shortcake Win By A Whisker Card Game

item.description:
This card game is like Old Maid except with a twist. Instead of being declared the loser, the player who is left with the Old Maid (in this case, the Custard card) is declared the winner.

The game begins by dealing out the 35 cards to all the players. Any pairs a player has are put down in front of them and the remaining cards are kept hidden. Players will then take turns picking a hidden card from another player. If a match is found, it is put down in front of the player that found it.

The game ends when one player is left holding the "Custard" card (Strawberry Shortcake's cat). They are declared the winner.

"Hobbycon (an animation, comic & game convention) is in town, but this time they got contest! Are you ready for it?"

A game where you compete with 1 or more players in a series of contest. Each player have 10 Effort Points which will be used differently in each contest. Each contest winner will be rewarded in Hobby Points. The highest Hobby Point by the end of the game is the winner.

download the game here
http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/2008/10/hobbycon-minigame-flyer.html

On a piece of land players have to construct houses and renovate them to villa's, with unexpected events obstruct or stimulate these actions. Use your cards well, place your houses tactical, negotiate smartly and create a dream villa from your house.

The player who obtains 12 points first is the winner.

Contents of the box:
• The gameboard
• 24 wooden houses
• 55 building cards
• 57 "voor- en tegenspoed" cards
• 4 evidence cards
• 40 banknotes
• 1 color dice
• 4 overview cards
• Rules

The monsters you heard about were real. They are everywhere, but hidden just out of sight. Well, just out of sight of most people.

There are dark conspiracies, and you will be able to glimpse them, and then battle them back into the night!

You were once ordinary, blind like the rest of them, but now you see, and you search for them and new ways to destroy them.

Hunter: Deadly Prey is a strategy board game for 3-5 players. One player will play a monster selected from a list of twelve, while the other players play hunters, imbued with supernatural powers to help humanity push back the night and the vile things within it. The problem is, are they all together, or will their individual personalities clash and make them less efficient?

A new boardgame for Hunter: The Vigil. This game includes:
â— 12 Hunters
â— 12 Monsters to choose from to defy hunters
â— 100 City Cards, monstrous secrets waiting to be uncovered
â— 75 Arsenal and Influence Cards, the dirty tricks that hunters and the monster play
â— 25 Hardship Cards, the penalties hunters pay for becoming obsessed with the unknown 
â— 10 Dice (10 sided)
â— 75 Tokens to indicate City Card values
â— 100 Counters representing Hunters' Willpower
â— 1 Turn marker

item.description:
A two player (with solo variant) dice game of pushing your luck, and out-guessing your opponent. Players take turns scoring by making runs (1,2,3,4) or matches (2,2,2,2,2) on their die rolls, while trying not to have their points stolen by their opponent's secret number.

Players only need eight six sided dice and the free rules to play this quick game.
A text file of the rules, with scoring examples, is available at http://tinyurl.com/DicersSecret-text

item.description:
The game is presented by the newspaper "Berliner Zeitung" and teaches a lot about Berlin.

Three types of cards (total 350 cards) ask for knowledge and creativity.

name.value: Tiger Woods PGA Tour DVD Family Game

item.description: Game allows players to play on two PGA Tour courses, St. Andrews (Scotland's home of golf) or TPC Sawgrass (Florida) with its famous island green. Players can choose from Tiger Woods, John Daly, Colin Montgomerie, and Jim Furyk each with different abilities. See what happens on the DVD, then decide what you would do! Play solo or with up to three other players. Game includes double sided game board representing the two courses and comes packaged in a nice wooden bookshelf game box.

Con6 is a unique game that combines elements of thinking, strategy and luck.

The aim of the game:
To be the first to form a sequence of 6 “riders”.

Game parts:
1) 24 triangular “bases” (large) – 12 per color.
2) 24 triangular “riders” (small) – 12 per color.
3) Game bag. 
4) Playing instructions.

Preparations for the game:
1) Each player chooses his color.
2) Each player places the 12 riders in the chosen color next to him.
3) The bases of both colors are inserted into the game bag and thoroughly mixed.

Course of play:
1) The younger player randomly draws a base out of the bag. The person whose color is the same as the base that has been drawn begins. The drawn base is returned to the bag.
2) Each player randomly draws one base from the bag and places it beside him, so that it is visible to both players.
3) The first player places his base on the table and randomly draws a new base from the bag. It is now the other player’s turn, and so on.
4) Each player, in his turn, can place a rider on a vacant base or place a new base next to an existing one, in accordance with the game rules. 
If a player chooses to place a base, he randomly draws a new base from the bag and places it beside him, so that it is visible to both players. 
 Winning the game:
The winner is the player who manages to form a sequence of 6 riders of his own color.

Path Is a unique game that combines elements of thinking, strategy, memory and luck. 
This version of the game is designed for two players and lasts 30 to 90 minutes.

A single player can use the game pieces for solving a range of puzzles of differing skill levels.
Solving the puzzles allows the player to learn the game pieces properly and train his memory and spatial perception that will help play the board game.

The aim of the game:
Being the first to form a path that connects the player's starting point to one of the destination points.

For more Information & full game instructions (English, German, French, Spanish and Hebrew) visit ToySmart website: http://www.ToySmart.co.il

item.description:
Players compete to be the first to create a pattern, as shown on a card, each player using 2 double sided tiles and a mirror.

With each extra copy of the game one or two more players can join the game.

In a nutshell: race to be the first to complete the pattern.

Each player represents an island inhabitant, who all are members of the mafia. Each player gets a set of certain tasks to fulfill, that means to get to certain places on the board.
After rolling the dice you move your meeple, if you stop on a green field, you have to fulfill a randomly drawn card, if you stop on a field occupied by another meeple, you can put money in your private "pocket". If the white and the red dice show the same number, the Vulcano erupts, that means you lose your money. The winner is the one with the most money after fulfilling all task-cards.

In Potions, everyone is a "wizarding" apprentice competing to become a wizard. The first apprentice to collect five Potion Class Credit Tokens wins. Players collect Potion Class Credit Tokens by being the first to obtain a set of cards that match the potion recipe as instructed by a roll of the potion dice. Watch out for other aspiring wizards – they will try to change the recipe, steal your ingredients, and spill your cauldron.

item.description: A Monopoly-like game produced by a non-profit organization, sponsored by businesses local to the Hayward, California area.

In this latest edition of the Loaded Questions line of games, it’s not a matter of how much you know about politics, but how well you know your fellow players. However serious or silly your answers, they are never right or wrong. Players write down answers to quasi-political questions and the judge for that round must try to match the answers to each player.

Sample Questions: 
“Who would make a terrible First Lady?” 
“If the US legalized cloning, who would you clone first?”
"What would you not expect to find in the Oval Office?"

There are triangles with different colours on their two surfaces (e.g. blue/green). The own colour is secretely chosen. The goal: To move two triangles of one´s own colour from the start to the opposite corner. You move a triangle by placing it on a adjacent field and turning it on the other surface (that causes a change of colour).

Players cover game tiles by identifying movies from clues given on Cast, Characters, Story, or Quote cards. Be the first to cover 4 tiles and win! Game covers 250 major movies, 70 top actors, and includes 32 game tiles.

Also includes a bonus Star Connection Card Game for added fun.

item.description: A name about Family names. split up in 3 phases. First phase, find out how usual 3 different family names are. Second phase, Quiz time about the meaning and the origins of family games. Third phase, get nearest to a number which is specified by one card with one name on it
